description: Responsive Design - Make the entire application usable on smartphones (375px+) using Tailwind responsive classes

userStories.title: Mobile header with hamburger toggle
userStories.description: As a mobile user, I want a top header bar with a hamburger menu icon so that I can access navigation without the sidebar permanently taking up screen space.
acceptanceCriteria: Below md breakpoint, a fixed top header bar is visible with a hamburger icon (left) and 'RalphDash' brand text (right of icon)
The header uses the same dark styling as the sidebar (bg-gray-900 border-b border-gray-800)
The hamburger icon is at least 44x44px touch target
Above md breakpoint, the header is hidden and the sidebar displays as it does today (fixed w-56)
Add sidebarOpen state and toggle handler in App.tsx, pass as props to Sidebar and the mobile header
Typecheck passes
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill

userStories.title: Sidebar as slide-out drawer on mobile
userStories.description: As a mobile user, I want the sidebar to slide in as an overlay drawer when I tap the hamburger icon, so I can navigate without losing content space.
acceptanceCriteria: Tapping the hamburger icon slides the sidebar in from the left over the content
A semi-transparent backdrop (bg-black/50 or similar) covers the content behind the drawer
Tapping the backdrop closes the sidebar
A close (x) button is visible inside the drawer to close it
Tapping a navigation link closes the sidebar and navigates to the selected page
Pressing Escape closes the sidebar on mobile
When the sidebar is closed, main content takes 100% viewport width
The sidebar drawer has the same content and styling as the desktop sidebar
Above md breakpoint, sidebar behaves as today (always visible, no overlay)

userStories.title: Main layout adapts to mobile

acceptanceCriteria: Below md, the main content area is w-full with no left margin/offset for the sidebar
Main content has top padding to account for the fixed mobile header height
The existing p-6 padding on main content reduces to p-4 on mobile for more usable space
Above md, layout is unchanged (sidebar + main side by side)
